intro: Phyllanthus jaubertii var. jaubertii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments, though its chemical composition remains under study.
